intro: Notoseris nanchuanensis, commonly known as the Nanchuan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy white seeds for wind dispersal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
